home.title: Weather Machine Solo Helper
home.play1: Play against Agent White and Agent Pink, the Solo Mode opponents of Weather Machine.
home.play2: This helper application replaces the solo cards and hideout board.

setupDifficultyLevel.title: Setup Difficulty Level
setupDifficultyLevel.firstTime: If you play the first time, go ahead to setup the game.
setupDifficultyLevel.greaterChallenge: For a greater challenge, you can use 1 or more additional challenges:

setupGame.title: Setup Game
setupGame.lativBots: Place one of Lativ’s Bots in each branch of the Weather Machine in the Lab.
setupGame.researchTokens: Use only 2 Research tokens of each type in each Main Location.
setupGame.goalTilesStep1: Remove all Goal tiles that show a majority icon in the top right. Also remove the tile that requires you to have 3 Award tokens.
setupGame.goalTilesStep2: From the remaining Goal tiles choose 2 of each color at random. If you draw any 2 with the same icon in the middle of the tile, discard the second, and keep drawing until you get all different ones.
setupGame.goalTilesStep3: Remove all remaining Goal tiles from the game. The Saboteurs do not use Goal tiles.
setupGame.anotherPlayerColor: Select another player color for the Saboteurs. The Saboteurs do not use a Laboratory or Voucher markers.
setupGame.scoringMarker: Place the Saboteurs’ Scoring marker on {startingTargetValue} CP. This is the initial Target Value.
setupGame.turnOrder: Place the Turn Order and Initiative markers (both yours and the Saboteurs’) with yourself being first in turn order on both.
setupGame.hideout: Designate an area near the Main board as the Saboteurs’ Hideout.
setupGame.hideoutBots: Place the Saboteur’s Bots in the Hideout.
setupGame.hideoutChemicals: Select the following Chemicals, take them from the leftmost spaces in the Supply, and place them in the Hideout:
setupGame.hideoutAward: The Saboteurs start the game with an Award token:
setupGame.placeAgentMiddlePosition: Place Agent {agent} on location {location}, middle action space.
setupGame.placeAgentRightPosition: Place Agent {agent} on location {location}, rightmost action space.
setupGame.takeWeatherToken: Move a {weather} Research token from that location to the hideout.

turnPlayer.title: Your Turn
turnPlayer.useSubsidyInvestment: Use 1 Subsidy tile OR 1 Investment tile.
turnPlayer.moveScientistRound1: Round 1: You are not allowed to select the leftmost action space.
turnPlayer.infoGovernmentRunMachine: When the government activates a branch of their machine, raise the Target Value by 3 for each Saboteur Bot in that branch.
turnPlayer.infoRndBreakthrough: When you perform a Breakthrough action, for each Saboteur Bot that provides a part for you when building your prototype, raise the Target Value by 2.

turnSaboteur.title: Saboteurs Turn
turnSaboteur.gameLost: The Security Report deck is empty. You've lost.
turnSaboteur.gameLostHopes: We had such high hopes for you.
turnSaboteur.raiseTargetValue: Raise Target Value for each piece left of the action space.

discardResearchTokens.text: The Saboteurs discard a set of {count} Research tokens, remove them from the game.

discardSecurityReport.text: The Saboteurs discard the top Security Report card from the deck.

drawSecurityReport.text: The Saboteurs discard the current Security Report and draw a new one.

governmentGetResearchToken.text: The Saboteurs take a Research token from the chosen branch.

governmentPlaceBotResearchPriority.text: Place a Bot onto an empty Bot space of a branch for which the Saboteurs have a matching Chemical. They prefer branches in the given order with available research tokens. Move the Chemical matching the space from the Hideout to the Supply.

governmentPlaceGearRemoveSubsidy.text-top: Remove the topmost available Subsidy tile from the branch. Replace it with the required Machine Part.
governmentPlaceGearRemoveSubsidy.text-bottom: Remove the bottommost available Subsidy tile from the branch. Replace it with the required Machine Part.

governmentRunMachine.text: If all Bot spaces of the branch are now full, the Government activates that branch. Raise the Target Value by 3 for each Saboteur Bot in that branch.

increaseTargetValueOrDiscardSecurityRepo.text: Either Raise the Saboteurs' Target Value by {count} or discard the top card of the Security Report deck.
increaseTargetValueOrDiscardSecurityRepo.increaseTargetValueOrDiscardSecurityRepo: Increase the target value of the Saboteurs? Otherwise a Security Report will be discarded.

lativsLabPlaceBotResearchPriority.text: Place a Bot onto an available Bot space of a branch for which the Saboteurs have a matching Chemical, and with a matching Experiment tile in the display. They prefer branches and spaces in the given order. Lativ's Bots may be moved away. Move the Chemical matching the space from the Hideout to the Supply.

rndChemicalAvailable.chemicalAvailable: Do the Saboteurs have a Chemical matching with the chosen Bot space?

rndGetResearchToken.text: The Saboteurs take a Research token from the chosen branch.

rndPlaceBotPreviousReportPriority.text: Place a Bot on an empty Bot space of a branch for which the Saboteurs have a matching Chemical. They prefer branches and spaces in the given order. The Saboteurs do not pay the additional cost if they place their Bot at the bottom space of the branch.

rndPlaceBotResearchPriority.text: Place a Bot onto an empty Bot space of a branch for which the Saboteurs have a matching Chemical. They prefer branches in the given order with available research tokens. Move the Chemical matching the space from the Hideout to the Supply.

rndPlaceChemical.text: The Saboteurs move a Chemical from their hideout to the chosen Bot space.

takeChemicals.text: The Saboteurs take {count} Chemical. | The Saboteurs take {count} Chemicals.

takeExtremeWeatherTile.text: Take the top Extreme Weather tile matching the type of weather from the stack and place it on the corresponding space in R&D, covering any tile already there. Any Breakthrough markers on the existing tile are returned to the box, and any Government markers are returned to the Government area.

unlockCitation.text: Remove the Lock token from the corresponding Citation space.

checkRunning.runsIfBoth: The experiment runs if both conditions are met:
checkRunning.atLeastOneTile: There is at least one Experiment tile in the display matching the weather of the active branch.
checkRunning.allBots: There is a Bot on every space in the active branch.

player.title: Your Turn
player.returnBots: Return your Bots from the active branch.
player.ifVouchersPayed: If you pay Science Vouchers of the active Experiment tile:
player.gainCP: Gain CP as depicted on the Experiment tile for each Bot you just returned.
player.gainBenefit: Gain one of the two benefits depicted on the tile.
player.takeResearchToken: Take a Research token from the active branch (if available).

saboteur.title: Saboteurs Turn
saboteur.returnBots: For each of the Saboteurs Bots in the active branch, return that Bot to the Hideout and raise the Target Value by the CP depicted on the Experiment tile.
saboteur.takeResearchToken: Take a Research token from below the active branch (if available).
saboteur.researchTokenAvailable: Is a research token available? If yes, choose the weather of the active branch.

afterExperiment.title: After the Experiment
afterExperiment.lativBotRemoveResearchToken: If there is one of Lativ’s Bots on the branch, remove from the game 1 Research token from below the active branch, if able.
afterExperiment.returnLativBots: Return any of Lativ’s Bots on the active branch to the side of the Lab.
afterExperiment.takeExtremeWeatherTile: Take the top Extreme Weather tile from the stack matching the type of weather and place it on the corresponding space in R&D.

notRunning.title: Experiment is not running
notRunning.returnPlayerBots: You may choose to return your bots from the active branch.
notRunning.saboteurBotExtremeWeather: If the Saboteurs have at least on Bot present in the active branch: Place a new Extreme Weather tile. The Bots stay in the branch.
notRunning.returnLativBots: Return any of Lativ’s Bots on the active branch to the side of the Lab.

prepareNext.title: Prepare for the next experiment
prepareNext.removeExperimentTile: Remove the rightmost Experiment tile in the display matching the weather of the active branch (if any). Refill the display.
prepareNext.moveLativAssistant: Move Lativ’s Assistant to the next branch.

endOfRound.title: End of Round
endOfRound.lativOffice: If Lativ is at his office:

unlockCitation.title: Unlock Citation Space
unlockCitation.description: If you unlocked the citation space, you may immediately pay 1 Science Voucher to gain 3 CP.

lativMovement.title: Moving Lativ
lativMovement.nextLocation: If Lativ moves, he goes to the next location with an available action space (left-most).
lativMovement.weatherMachineActiveBranch: Check the active branch of the Weather Machine in the Lab (the one where the Assistant is).
lativMovement.weatherMachineActiveBranchStep1: If Lativ does not have one of his Bots in that branch, place 1 of Lativ’s Bots from the area next to the Lab onto any empty space of the branch (it doesn’t matter which one).
lativMovement.weatherMachineActiveBranchStep2: If Lativ already has a Bot in the branch, or the branch was full, place a Bot in the next branch (following the arrows). If all the branches are either full or already contain one of Lativ’s Bots, nothing happens.
lativMovement.governmentRnd: When Lativ moves to the Government or R&D, discard a Research token from Lativ’s current Location of the same type of weather as the branch where Lativ’s Assistant currently is.

callSecurity.title: Call Security
callSecurity.confirm: Do you want to call security?
callSecurity.payVoucher: To continue, you have to pay 1 Voucher (of the type matching the Location where you are, or a science voucher).

takeChemical.title: Take Chemical
takeChemical.prioritySection: They select a Chemical from the section that depicts the fewest number of Supply Vouchers.
takeChemical.priorityLeastAvailable: If there is more than one type of Chemical in the cheapest section, they take the one they currently have the least of in their Hideout.

prioritySelection.top: If still tied, they take the topmost one from those tied.
prioritySelection.bottom: If still tied, they take the bottommost one from those tied.

fully-stocked-opponents.title: Fully Stocked Opponents
fully-stocked-opponents.description: The Saboteurs start the game with 1 of each Chemical instead of 2 Chemicals.

jamming-device.title: Jamming Devices
jamming-device.description: During each income, increase the Target Value by 1 for each Saboteur Bot on the board.

creative-accounting.title: Creative Accounting
creative-accounting.description: The Saboteurs start the game with an Award token. During each income, move one of your Funding markers back one space on one of the tracks. You must choose a track where you are able to do this, if possible.

nobel-laureate.title: Nobel Laureate
nobel-laureate.description: The Saboteurs start the game with an additional Chemical chosen at random (it may be the same as one they already have). You cannot win the game unless you have the Nobel Prize.

only-overachievers-apply.title: Only Overachievers Apply
only-overachievers-apply.description: You cannot win the game unless you meet the conditions of at least 5 of your Goal tiles on the Goal spaces of your Laboratory.

the-clock-is-ticking.title: The Clock is Ticking
the-clock-is-ticking.description: 2 cards of the Security Report deck are removed from play.

one-step-ahead.title: One Step Ahead
one-step-ahead.description: If, at the end of your turn, the Saboteurs’ Initiative marker is in the leftmost position, raise the Target Value by 3.

moral-high-ground.title: Moral High Ground
moral-high-ground.description: When placing your Scientist in a Location, you do not gain additional Vouchers for Saboteurs to your left.

peer-review.title: Peer Review
peer-review.description: You cannot use Citation tokens when publishing a paper. When you unlock a Citation space, you cannot pay a Science Voucher to gain 3 CP.

independent-prototypes.title: Independent Prototypes
independent-prototypes.description: The Saboteurs start the game with an Award. You cannot use the Saboteurs’ Bots when building a prototype as part of a Breakthrough action.

budget-cuts.title: Budget Cuts
budget-cuts.description: The Saboteurs start the game with an additional Chemical chosen at random (it may be the same as one they already have). Whenever you receive funding from the Lab Funding track, treat the modifier below your marker as +0 (you still gain the benefits of the Government or R&D track).

publish-or-perish.title: Publish or Perish
publish-or-perish.description: Lower the starting Target Value by 5. Whenever the Saboteurs cause a Lock token to be removed from a Citation space, raise the Target Value by 5. You must win by immediate victory (restoring the good name of Lightning Technologies).

action.abortGameConfirm: Aborting the running game - are you sure?
action.endGameConfirm: End this game and return to home screen - are you sure?
